snippet: Goldman Sachs is set to invest $9.6 million in a New York City jail program. The move, which could bolster the financial firm's reputation, could also prove to be a profitable one. Goldman will make money if the program lowers recidivism rates,...
abstract: Goldman Sachs is set to invest $9.6 million in a New York City jail program. The move, which could bolster the financial firm's reputation, could also prove to be a profitable one. Goldman will make money if the program lowers recidivism rates, reports David W. Chen of the New York Times.

headline.main: Goldman Sachs to Invest in Jail Program
